Comment: After an aggressive start, Black has to constantly retreat when opposing advancing pawns that own the center and rooks that own the c-file.

Here's another position where lots of moves looked good and I settled on my first choice.
I liked Nd3 - but not sure where it goes. I even like Qc2, but I couldn't find anything to do with the doubled pawns after all of the trades on e5 (I was trying to find a way to take advantage of the bishop on b2 and moving the queen to c3).
With the move I chose, I expect him to take my knight -- and I haven't completely decided whether to recapture with the knight or bishop.

You're going to ask me why I captured this way instead of using the knight. I wasn't comfortable letting my knight get pinned -- though I don't see a way he can take advantage of it. I can of feel he has more options with his bishop (he can play it to h6) than I have with mine (a3 isn't attractive). But I'm not thrilled that we're getting closer to an endgame where I have the knight to his bishop. I'm going to need to hurry and take advantage of my rook on the c-file while his rook is still out of play.
